intro: Weinmannia apurimacensis, commonly known as the Apurimac weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, montane forests at elevations between 2,000 and 3,500 meters. Its botanical features include pinnately divided leaves and a branching structure that supports its growth in rocky or forested habitats. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
